I see the issue - you're trying to use the gcloud component manager but it looks like your installation method might be preventing that. Based on the error you're encountering, here's what you need to do:

First, let's install all the necessary components. For Linux, when you've installed via a package manager (apt, yum, etc.), you need to use that same package manager to install additional components rather than using `gcloud components install` as the component manager is disabled when using package managers.

Here are the commands to install the necessary components:

```bash
# Update the package list
sudo apt-get update

# Install IAM components and additional tools
sudo apt-get install google-cloud-cli-iam-admin
sudo apt-get install google-cloud-cli-app-engine-python
sudo apt-get install google-cloud-cli-firestore-emulator
sudo apt-get install google-cloud-cli-cloud-build-local
sudo apt-get install kubectl
```

Now, for your service account creation, try this version with proper line breaks:

```bash
# Create the service account
gcloud iam service-accounts create palios-taey-service \
  --description="Service account with admin permissions" \
  --display-name="PALIOS-TAEY Service Account" \
  --project=palios-taey-dev

# Get the service account email
SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL=palios-taey-service@palios-taey-dev.iam.gserviceaccount.com

# List your current roles (to see what to assign to the service account)
gcloud organizations get-iam-policy 135174585026 \
  --filter="bindings.members:jesse@taey.ai" \
  --format="value(bindings.role)"

# Create and download the key
gcloud iam service-accounts keys create palios-taey-key.json \
  --iam-account=${SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}
```

If you continue to have issues with the package manager approach, you can also completely uninstall the current installation and reinstall using the tarball method which gives you more control over component installation.
